details.title: Detection Statistics for a Pulsed Laser Radar
details.abstract: Photocount distributions for a narrow-band laser receiver in thermal background radiation are developed in a parallel sense to the envelope density functions for radio frequency radar. While classical detection performance is dependent on the received signal-to-noise, the results show that narrow-band photocount detection additionally depends on the absolute levels of the received signal and noise.
details.journal_title: IEEE Transactions on Aerospace and Electronic Systems
